item.title: Can you really depuff your face? The truth about three common treatments
item.content:encoded: We look at three viral hacks to unpick fact from fiction - the effects are often at best, temporary, say experts.

item.title: Oasis v Blur rivalry being revived in new play as cast take sides
item.content:encoded: The 1995 chart battle is recreated for a new play - and the rivalry is rekindled as the cast take sides.

item.title: Bailiffs used to pursue NHS staff over pay errors
item.content:encoded: Thousands of NHS workers were pursued by debt collectors after salary overpayments, the BBC finds.

item.title: Facing a demographic catastrophe, Ukraine is paying for troops to freeze their sperm
item.content:encoded: The law funds troops who want to freeze their eggs or their sperm, as Ukraine's population plummets.

item.title: Actor Robert Duvall, who starred in The Godfather, dies aged 95
item.content:encoded: The Oscar-winner died "peacefully" at his home in Middleburg, Virginia, on Sunday, his family says.

item.title: The tech bros might show more humility in Delhi – but will they make AI any safer?
item.content:encoded: As global tech leaders meet Delhi, India hopes to level the playing field for countries outside the US and China.

item.title: The tech bros might show more humility in Delhi – but will they make AI any safer?
item.content:encoded: As global tech leaders meet Delhi, India hopes to level the playing field for countries outside the US and China.

item.title: The Papers: 'Farage forces elections U-turn' and 'Tributes to Godfather Star'
item.content:encoded: Sir Keir Starmer's decision to abandon plans to delay 30 council elections after a legal challenge from Reform UK dominates Tuesday's papers.

item.title: Reddit's human content wins amid the AI flood
item.content:encoded: Reddit says its human contributors are valued amid an internet awash with AI-generated content.

item.title: Hillary Clinton accuses Trump administration of Epstein files 'cover-up' in BBC interview
item.content:encoded: "Get the files out. They are slow-walking it," the former US secretary of state says. The White House says it has done "more for the victims than Democrats ever did".

item.title: FA Cup heroes Macclesfield make memories to last a lifetime
item.content:encoded: Macclesfield's FA Cup odyssey may have ended against Brentford but they have made memories to last a lifetime, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

item.title: A big day for GB's men's curling team - Tuesday's guide
item.content:encoded: What's happening and who to look out for at the 2026 Winter Olympics in Milan-Cortina.

item.title: GB men's curlers' semi-final hopes on line after shock defeat
item.content:encoded: The Winter Olympics medal hopes of Team GB's men's curlers have been cast into doubt after a shock 8-6 defeat by Norway left them scrambling to make the semi-finals in Cortina.

item.title: How dark web agent spotted bedroom wall clue to rescue girl from years of harm
item.content:encoded: Detectives desperate to locate a 12-year-old, seen abused online, found a surprising lead.

item.title: Muir fourth in big air in another medal near-miss
item.content:encoded: Freestyle skier Kirsty Muir once again comes heartbreakingly close to a Winter Olympic medal for Team GB with her second fourth-place finish of the Games.

item.title: 'People shouldn't be dying just for existing' - Gauff on US issues
item.content:encoded: Coco Gauff says it is "tough to wake up" and see what is happening back home in the United States amid the president's immigration crackdown.

item.title: Will we see changes to first England squad in 2026?
item.content:encoded: The Lionesses return to competitive action next month as their campaign to qualify for the 2027 Women's World Cup begins. So what changes could we see?

item.title: Six of Sarah Ferguson's companies winding down
item.content:encoded: The move follows further revelations over her friendship with the convicted paedophile Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Australian IS families in Syria camp turned back after leaving for home
item.content:encoded: The group of 34 women and children with family links to Islamic State group have been held in the Roj camp for nearly seven years.

item.title: League One Mansfield to host Arsenal in fifth round - full FA Cup draw
item.content:encoded: League One club Mansfield will host record 14-time winners Arsenal at Field Mill in the FA Cup fifth round, as Manchester City head to Newcastle in a repeat of the League Cup semi-final.

item.content:encoded: League One club Mansfield will host record 14-time winners Arsenal at Field Mill in the FA Cup fifth round, as Manchester City head to Newcastle in a repeat of the League Cup semi-final.

item.title: Students begin Covid compensation claim against 36 more universities
item.content:encoded: It comes after University College London settled a claim from students there over lost learning in the pandemic.

item.content:encoded: A look at the life of the prolific actor whose many films included Apocalypse Now and The Godfather.

item.title: 'I bring a circus' - ringmaster Fury in 'prime' for Makhmudov fight
item.content:encoded: Showman Tyson Fury says he is "coming back to make boxing great again" as he prepares to fight Russia's Arslanbek Makhmudov in April.

item.title: US build-up of warships and fighter jets tracked near Iran
item.content:encoded: BBC Verify has seen US aircraft carrier USS Abraham Lincoln near Iran ahead of talks between the two countries

item.title: Government abandons plans to delay 30 council elections
item.content:encoded: All English elections will now go ahead as originally planned after Reform UK brought a legal challenge over the decision to delay some polls.

item.title: Teenagers guilty of killing man they thought was a paedophile
item.content:encoded: Alexander Cashford was chased and hit with rocks and a bottle before he died.

item.title: Ancient bone may prove legendary war elephant crossing of Alps
item.content:encoded: It would be the first hard evidence that elephants were used in battle by General Hannibal.

item.content:encoded: Millions will vote in parliamentary elections in Scotland and Wales, and local elections in England.

item.content:encoded: More than 70 flood warnings have also been issued by the Environment Agency after heavy rain.

item.content:encoded: The popular tourist attraction was a proposal spot for couples and featured on postcards.

item.content:encoded: One passenger was taken to hospital after the derailment, which police say could have been caused by an avalanche.

item.title: GB slalom legend Ryding bids farewell to Olympics
item.content:encoded: Slalom skier Dave Ryding bids farewell to the Winter Olympics with a 17th-place finish in mixed conditions in Bormio.

item.title: Royal Mail letters sit undelivered 'for weeks' as parcels prioritised, staff say
item.content:encoded: Staff and customers tell the BBC prioritising parcels can mean missed NHS appointments and late payment fines.

item.content:encoded: The truck is supporting those who can not afford meals outside of school term-time.

item.title: Lloyds boss accepts concern over use of staff data in pay talks

item.title: Ski jumper disqualified for wearing oversized boots

item.content:encoded: The US president wants American energy firms to start extracting the crude but they are reluctant.

item.content:encoded: Officers knew CCTV discredited their key witness in Omar Benguit's conviction for murder of Korean woman.

item.content:encoded: With an annual growth rate of 3.1%, Manchester's economy has performed twice as well as that of the UK as a whole.

item.content:encoded: A Super Bowl advert had sparked new scrutiny of the smart doorbell company's privacy practices.

item.title: Inflation eases in US as prices for used cars fall

item.content:encoded: Sultan Ahmed bin Sulayem’s exit comes after files showed he appears to have exchanged hundreds of emails with Epstein.
